description: The Spiritual Administration of Muslims of Crimea and Sevastopol registered the Cathedral Mosque in Simferopol as their property. The complex includes a three-story main building, courtyard, minarets, administrative building, parking, and auxiliary buildings.
original:
The objects of the Cathedral Mosque in Simferopol were registered as the property of the Spiritual Administration of Muslims of Crimea and Sevastopol, the State Committee for Register of the Republic reported.

The property complex of the Cathedral Mosque includes the main three-story building with a total area of more than 4.3 thousand square meters. meters, a courtyard with colonnades and a shadirvan, four minarets 50 meters high. There is also a four-story administrative building with an area of about 3.5 thousand square meters. meters, parking, auxiliary buildings and a guest building of 1.2 thousand “squares”.

Construction of the facility began in 2016 and was completed at the end of last year. The official opening date of the mosque has not yet been announced

description: A draft law on mobilization requires men aged 18-60 to carry a military ID, regardless of fitness for service or deferments. This will affect all men, from 18 to 60 years of age, regardless of their fitness for service or deferments.

Every man of this age will be required to carry a military ID. And present it at the request of the police, TCC employees, as well as border guards - both at checkpoints and in the border zone. description: The Supreme Court of Bashkortostan increased the prison term of Liliya Chanysheva, ex-head of Navalny's headquarters in Ufa, from 7.5 to 9.5 years. Chanysheva was initially sentenced in 2023 for creating an 'extremist community' and was taken to correctional colony No. 28 in Berezniki, Perm Territory.
original:
Forwarded from: Siren
⚡The court toughened the sentence of Liliya Chanysheva. The Supreme Court of Bashkortostan increased the prison term of the ex-head of Navalny's headquarters in Ufa, Liliya Chanysheva, by two years. The prosecutor's office demanded that the punishment be increased from 7.5 to 10 years in prison; the court decided to sentence the oppositionist to 9.5.

In 2023, Chanysheva was sentenced to 7.5 years in prison in the case of creating an “extremist community,” in which Navalny’s associates were persecuted in the regions. The ex-chief of staff did not admit his guilt. In December, she was taken to correctional colony No. 28 in Berezniki, Perm Territory.

“Sirena” told in detail how Chanysheva’s successful political activities brought the oppositionist to jail.@news_sirena

description: A 44-year-old woman in Poland attacked her partner with a soup bone during an argument over local election results in Bartoszyce. The victim was hospitalized with head injuries requiring stitches. The woman, with a prior conviction for partner violence, was detained and faces 7.5 years in prison for a repeat offense.
original:
“While arguing about the election results, she injured her partner with a soup bone”: In Poland, discussions about politics in the kitchen have reached a new level.

“Police from Bartoszyce detained a 44-year-old woman who, during an argument with her partner over the results of local elections in the city, took a bone from the pan in which she was cooking soup and hit her partner on the head with it. An ambulance took the man to the hospital because he was covered in blood as a result of his injuries. It was necessary to put stitches on the wound.
The couple testified to police that the quarrel between them occurred over the results of local elections in Bartoszyce.
The detained woman is now in police custody. She has a past conviction for partner violence and is on probation. As a result, she will be prosecuted for a repeat offense and faces 7.5 years in prison."

event: Ban on Gita and Princess Kandy Teas
description: Belarus banned the sale of four types of bagged tea produced in Russia, including Geeta and Princess Kandy, due to non-compliance with microbiological safety requirements. A temporary ban on trade in these products is recommended in Russia, but its implementation may be challenging without proper labeling and tracking.
original:
Is it time to ban the sale of Gita and Princess Kandy teas, following Belarus? Deputy Minister of Health, Chief Sanitary Doctor of Belarus Alexander Tarasenko signed a decree banning the sale in the country of four types of bagged tea produced in Russia. We are talking about the trademarks “Geeta” and “Princess Kandy”. The reason for the restriction was the product’s non-compliance with microbiological safety requirements.

A temporary ban on trade in these types of tea should also be introduced in Russia, noted Pavel Shapkin, Chairman of the National Union for the Protection of Consumer Rights, in a conversation with Paragraph. However, it is unlikely that it will be possible to do this promptly even if an appropriate decision is made. “It makes sense to introduce a temporary ban [on trade in these products]. It’s just that as long as these products are not labeled, it is very difficult to implement the ban. If these products were immediately blocked at checkouts for sale, then it would be possible to somehow track the process. Since this will be some kind of recommendation posted somewhere on the website of, say, Rospotrebnadzor, many stores may not follow it. In fact, the sale will continue,” Shapkin explained. Subscribe to “Paragraph”

event: Modernization of Hwasong-5 and Hwasong-6 Missiles
description: The DPRK updated its large stock of Hwasong-5 and Hwasong-6 missiles by equipping them with cluster warheads and aerodynamic surfaces, increasing their accuracy and effectiveness against area targets and small targets.
location: Pyongyang, Democratic People's Republic of Korea
original:
At one time, missiles and countries with old missiles of the SCUD family were faced with the fact that already at the turn of the 1980-90s the missile was clearly outdated (as a non-nuclear weapon) due to low accuracy. Therefore, without weapons of mass destruction, they were only suitable for harassing attacks on cities. And the DPRK took one of the most interesting paths. There they decided to somehow update the large stocks of Hwasong-5 and Hwasong-6 missiles they had produced until a replacement was found.

The first option, back in the 1990-2000s, was the creation of a variety of cluster warheads equipped with various submunitions. This made it possible to make not very accurate old missiles, even without WMD warheads, quite effective at least against area targets such as airfields. New head parts just went to warehouses, and were installed in the same way before use. Without the need to make changes to the rocket itself.

The second option, already in the second half of the 2010s, was to equip the old Hwasong-5 missiles with a warhead with aerodynamic surfaces. This made it possible to control the final section and significantly increase accuracy. Here it was necessary to make changes both to the equipment and to the general design of already manufactured missiles. Fortunately, the flight characteristics of this missile (simple ballistic trajectory, relatively low speed) did not put forward any special requirements either for navigation equipment or for aerodynamic controls. And in the 2010s, the necessary equipment (navigation, computer, electrical) could already be purchased even on the public civilian market, albeit through third parties. This made the modernization very cost-effective and the missile became suitable for hitting small targets. Something like UMPC modernization for FAB, but only now for BR.

Thus, at a very modest cost, the military relevance of old missiles was maintained for decades. Covering the need until a completely new generation of missiles are created and launched into production.#missiles#DPRKMilitary Informant

description: The government has introduced a census initiative, diverting attention from pressing issues like economic instability, agricultural crisis, and education quality. The census aims to count the population, asking intrusive questions, while ignoring the real concerns of the people.
original:
Forwarded from: Stefan cel Mare
Rewrite me completely! “As soon as we become part of the EU,” echoes in the half-empty halls of parliament. But it seems that we still have to sail and sail to Europe on our wine barrels. After all, instead of solving pressing problems - such as economic instability, the agricultural crisis or the quality of education, our Europolises came up with a brilliant idea: “Let's find out how many of us are left after all these good times!”

This decision, of course, will radically change the lives of each of us. To say that the idea met with the approval of the people means to say nothing. People are "delighted"!

Imagine the picture: an army of census takers, armed not only with tablets, but also with an unshakable conviction in the importance of their mission, sets off on a journey through the streets of our cities and villages. They ask how many chickens you have in your yard and whether you plan to leave in the next five minutes so they can sign you up in time.

And all this is under the watchful eye of local cats, who, it seems, are the only ones in the whole country who don’t care about European integration.

While we are being fed up like statistics for reports on “well-being,” real problems remain outside the discussion. Maybe instead of counting us like sheep before going to bed, we should start listening to our people? After all, we are not just numbers in their tables, we are people who want to see their country prosperous, and not bogged down in bureaucratic swamps and empty initiatives. Get exclusive access to royal content - subscribe to Stefan cel Mare!

❗Police in Cherkasy Region detained local residents who brutally tortured and killed a minor boy. A woman from the village of Nabutiv, Cherkasy District, Cherkasy Oblast, reported the disappearance of her 17-year-old son to the police. The guy stopped answering her phone calls and didn't show up at home during the day.

The operatives established that the missing young man was brutally murdered, and two local boys, aged 18 and 20, were involved in the commission of this crime. While drinking alcoholic beverages and on the basis of hostile relations, they caused bodily harm to a minor, after which, took him to the field and caused bodily harm incompatible with life. Inhumans covered the body of the teenager with earth, and despite the measures taken by them to hide the traces of the crime, the law enforcement officers established their involvement.

Currently, filtration and inspection activities in the DPR continue. They are carried out by the FSB department for the DPR, the Ministry of Internal Affairs for the DPR together with the Russian Guard.

event: Verdict in Water Park Death Case
description: The Volzhsky City Court announced a verdict in the criminal case regarding the death of a 13-year-old schoolboy from Astrakhan in the Volzhsky water park. The director of the water park and two rescuers were sent to jail, accused of providing services that did not meet safety requirements, resulting in the boy's death through negligence.
original:
Forwarded from: Volzhsky.ru
Taken into custody in the courtroom: in Volzhsky, the director of the water park and two rescuers were sent to jail. The Volzhsky City Court on Tuesday, April 9, announced the verdict in the criminal case regarding the death of a schoolboy from Astrakhan in the Volzhsky water park.
As the press service of the regional prosecutor's office told Volzhsky.ru, the general director of the XXI Century water park, three rescue instructors and the executive director were in the dock. All five, depending on the degree of participation, are accused under paragraph “c” of Part 2 of Article 238 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation - provision of services that do not meet safety requirements, resulting in the death of a person through negligence. Let us remind you that on June 26, 2022, while descending from a water attraction in one of the pools, a 13-year-old boy who did not know how to swim drowned.

More details on Volzhsky.ru: https://www.volzsky.ru/index.php?wx=16&wx2=73303

description: The Vatican issued a declaration opposing gender reassignment and surrogacy, stating that these practices constitute an insult to human dignity. The Catholic Church views gender diversity as an 'ideology' that impairs the humanistic vision of man and woman. The declaration also condemns persecution, torture, and murder based on sexual orientation.
original:
The Catholic Church yesterday officially opposed gender reassignment and gender diversity (meaning there are more than two genders).

For the first time in five years, the Vatican issued a declaration according to which gender reassignment, surgical or any other means, as well as surrogacy, constitute an insult to human dignity.

With surrogacy, the child, according to Catholics, becomes an “object.” The Catholic Church also called the gender approach an “ideology.”

“We believe that such an ideology, rather than promoting the recognition of dignity, impoverishes the humanistic vision in which man and woman represent the most beautiful combination in the greatest difference that humanity contains.”

The document caused “fright among LGBTQ rights advocates,” writes the New York Times. However, they acknowledge that the declaration also condemns the persecution, torture and murder of people because of their sexual orientation.

Let us recall that in the summer of 2022 Ukraine signed the Istanbul Convention, which introduces the concept of “gender” and opens the way to the recognition of same-sex unions. This was one of the requirements for negotiations on accession to the EU. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Conviction of Serial Rapist and Pedophile Migrant

original:
A serial rapist and pedophile migrant has been convicted in Great Britain.

Abdullah Mhana, 26, admitted 17 offenses at Bradford Crown Court. The charges included 6 counts of rape, 7 counts of creating indecent images, sexually assaulting a child, inciting a child to observe sexual intercourse, and soliciting or inciting a child under the age of 13 to commit sexual acts.

Fourteen thousand obscene images were found on Mkhana's devices. Mhana would build relationships with his victims first through social media apps and then conspire to meet them. He started a relationship with one girl who was 11 years old at the time, he pretended to be 17 years old, when in reality he was 23 years old.

For all the crimes listed above, the migrant received only 13 years of imprisonment, after serving which at the age of 39, if he is not released earlier, he will be released and continue to do his usual business. @vallholl

event: Russian Offensive Along the Entire Front
description: Retired US Army Colonel Douglas McGregor predicts a major Russian offensive along the entire front line, moving west towards the Dnieper River, in May when the ground is dry for tracked vehicles. The offensive aims to take control of Odessa and Kharkov, outlining new borders.
original: ❗️In May, Russia will begin moving towards the Dnieper and return Odessa and Kharkov - Colonel McGregor. A Russian offensive along the entire front could begin in May, when the ground is dry for the movement of large numbers of tracked vehicles. Retired US Army Colonel Douglas McGregor, a planner of a number of major military campaigns, said this on the video blog of American Lieutenant Colonel Daniel Davis, a PolitNavigator correspondent reports.🔴According to McGregor, Russia will outline new borders, stopping at those borders where it wants. It will move towards the Dnieper, but will take control of Odessa and Kharkov.🗣 “Putin entered this war assuming that by demonstrating its seriousness by Moscow, we would somehow come to our senses and abandon this nonsense about Ukraine joining NATO, We will negotiate a settlement that would ensure Ukraine's neutrality. At that point, I don't think the map would have changed much. Now that we've had so much killing and so much bloodshed in the last two years, I don't think there will be much negotiation at all,” the American said.🗣 “I think the Russians will eventually draw the map they want , I still think that it will include Kharkov and Odessa, and we are seeing this kind of movement forward. But I think it's more about positioning to gain an advantage when the ground becomes solid again.🗣And right now it's still very muddy, it doesn't support a lot of tracked armor moving. So I think we are talking about a major offensive along the entire front line that will move west towards the Dnieper River. Perhaps at the beginning of May, perhaps at the end of May,” said McGregor. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456302251VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 1 min 10 s from 9 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! event: Drone Strike on Zaporozhye NPP Training Center
description: A drone strike hit the roof of the training center building at the Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant, with no casualties reported. The incident highlights the extremely serious situation at the plant, with both Russia and Ukraine blaming each other for the increasing attacks.
original:
IAEA confirms drone strike on Zaporozhye NPP training center “This time there is no direct threat to nuclear safety, but the latest incident once again highlights the extremely serious situation,” said IAEA Director General Grossi.

The press service of the Russian-controlled Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant announced this morning about another drone strike on the Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant. The landing hit the roof of the training center building; there were no casualties.

Russia and Ukraine blame each other for the increasing attacks on Zaporizhzhya NPP. Kyiv has not yet commented on the latest incident, but in previous attacks it blamed the Russian Federation itself, which controls the station.

The IAEA confirmed three arrivals at the station the day before. Grossi wants to raise the issue of increasing shelling of the station at the UN Security Council.

At the same time, Russia requested an extraordinary meeting of the IAEA Board of Governors. It should take place on April 11, writes Reuters, citing three diplomats.

description: French President Macron met with Serbian President Vucic, urging Serbia to join the EU, claiming it would become a great country. Vucic expressed interest in purchasing 12 Rafale fighters and praised French air-to-ground missiles.
original:
Macron extended his hand to Vucic and immediately told a big lie: the French President is still a hypocrite and a storyteller. Let's start with the fact that the President of Serbia, Alexander Vucic, personally came to visit Macron. A detailed conversation took place between them, which resulted in a fiery press conference.

So, at it, the French President said that Serbia should not doubt its choice. And there is no reason to talk about the advisability of joining the EU. For a moment, Serbia has been waiting for this since 2012.

In fact, Macron made it clear that you should not doubt that you will be with Europe or with anyone else. Against the backdrop of recent events, Vucic, apparently, somehow wondered whether he needed this union with the EU.

And so that he would not rush from side to side, Macron even said that no one would impose anything. This is a free choice, but at the same time, only in union with the EU, in his opinion, will Serbia become a great country. After all, Europe is a “blooming garden”, and everything else is a jungle.

Meanwhile, Vučić also did not mince words: he stated that he wanted to reach an agreement on the purchase of 12 Rafale fighters, and at the same time praised French air-to-ground missiles. This is what sitting on two chairs at once does to people; there is also a more significant saying about a fish and a bone, and also about other things that fully characterize the throwing of the President of Serbia.

Subscribe to @brekotin

description: Poland's Electoral Commission announced the final results of Sunday's local elections for regional parliaments in each of Poland's 16 provinces. The Law and Justice Party (PiS) received the most votes overall, but Civic Platform (KO) became the largest group in nine of the 16 provincial parliaments.
original:
🇵🇱Poland's Electoral Commission announced the final results of Sunday's local elections for regional parliaments in each of Poland's 16 provinces.

The Law and Justice Party (PiS) received the most votes overall. However, Civic Platform (KO), led by Prime Minister Donald Tusk, became the largest group in nine of the 16 provincial parliaments.

In total, PiS won 34.3% of the vote nationwide, ahead of KO with 30.6%. They are followed by the Third Way with 14.3%, the Confederation with 7.2% and the New Left with 6.3%.

Voter turnout was 51.9%, three points lower than the 54.9% recorded in the last local elections in 2018.

KO turned out to be the largest group in the provincial parliaments of Lower Silesia (where it received 33.5% of the votes), Western Pomerania (38.9%), Kuyavian-Pomeranian (38.3%), Lubusz (34.7%), Opole ( 36.5%), Pomeranian (43.8%), Silesian (32.4%), Warmian-Masurian (34.9%), Greater Poland (32%).

PiS took first place in Lublin (where it received 47.2% of the votes), Łódź (37.6%), Lesser Poland (43.9%), Mazowieckie (33.2%), Podkarpackie (52%), Podlaski (43 .5%) and Świętokrzyskie voivodeships (42%).

However, ultimate control of these regional assemblies will depend on the formation of alliances that will secure a majority. KO, which rules nationally alongside the Third Way and the New Left, is considered to have much greater potential for forming such coalitions than PiS, which may seek agreements with the Confederation.#Poland#government@pl_syrenka - Poland is not a foreign country

event: US Senate Hearing on Ukraine Conflict
description: The US Senate held a hearing on the Ukrainian conflict, where Senator Eric Schmitt criticized the Biden administration for lacking an 'exit strategy' and allowing for a 'blank check' for an endless war without clear goals. Pentagon chief Lloyd Austin was present at the hearing.
original: 🇺🇸The US Senate announced that the Biden administration has no “exit strategy” from the Ukrainian conflict. According to Senator Eric Schmitt, the White House is acting as if it did not notice the “threat of endless conflict” in Ukraine. Schmitt made this statement at a hearing before the Senate Armed Services Committee, where Pentagon chief Lloyd Austin was present. “Part of the problem is that the current administration has not outlined an exit strategy. In my opinion, we are talking about a blank check for a war that, without any clearly defined goals, will be endless <...> In my opinion, we do not have adequate control over how the money is spent. “Victory” is not defined,” the senator added.

Israel will not submit to violence and extortion, will not tolerate unilateral violation of trade agreements, and will take parallel measures against Turkey that will harm the Turkish economy. I have ordered the preparation of another list of products that Israel will prevent Turkey from exporting, and have also directed that organizations in the United States be contacted, invest in Turkey stopped, and products from Turkey be prevented from being imported to our friends in America. Congress will review violations of the boycott laws and impose appropriate sanctions on Turkey." , - said the head of the Israeli Foreign Ministry. @voice_of_turkey

event: Meeting between Aleksandar Vucic and Emmanuel Macron
description: Aleksandar Vucic and Emmanuel Macron met at the Elysee Palace to discuss Serbia's European integration. Macron emphasized the importance of harmonizing Serbia's foreign policy with the EU and resolving the Kosovo issue. Vucic expressed gratitude for Macron's understanding and highlighted Belgrade's fulfillment of agreements on normalizing relations with Kosovo.
original:
BalkanistVideo, Aleksandar Vucic and Emmanuel Macron met at the Elysee Palace🇷🇸🇨🇵@balkanistAt a meeting with Aleksandar Vucic in Paris, Emmanuel Macron once again confirmed that Serbia's European integration is in the interests of France. “Regardless of the wounds of the previous period, Serbia must know that its future is in the EU . You should not doubt Europe’s intention to accept you,” Macron said. According to the French President, important conditions for joining the European Union are the harmonization of Serbia’s foreign policy with the European one and the resolution of the Kosovo issue.

After an emotional speech about how much his stay at the Elysee Palace meant to him, Aleksandar Vucic told Macron that he did not want to talk much about Kosovo, but must note that Belgrade has fulfilled all agreements on the normalization of relations, while Pristina has still not fulfilled promises about the Union of Serbian Municipalities.

Vučić also said that he discussed with Macron the issue of the admission of the self-proclaimed Republic of Kosovo into the Council of Europe, which is unacceptable for Serbia, and thanked the French President for his understanding. “I know how some people were impatient to deal with Serbia, but thank you for thinking differently , like them, and for understanding that together we must maintain stability in the Western Balkans,” Vucic told Macron. description: The first Embraer E190F, a passenger aircraft converted for cargo operations, successfully completed its maiden flight on 5 April. The two-hour flight marks the beginning of the second phase of evaluation and inspection before entering commercial service.

Following successful ground cabin pressure testing and container loading, the very first Embraer E190F, a passenger aircraft converted for cargo operations, made its maiden flight on 5 April. The flight lasted two hours and kicks off the second phase of the aircraft's evaluation and inspection program before entering commercial service.

When the conversion program for the E190 and E195 aircraft was launched by Embraer in March 2022, the Brazilian manufacturer set a target of entering service within 2024. Therefore, the deadline for bringing the car to the market seems to have been met.

description: Vyacheslav Simonenko, former head of IT company Merlion, faces 24 years imprisonment for attempting to raid the company with Investigative Committee and FSB employees. He allegedly conspired with law enforcement officers to extort 15 billion rubles from co-founders in exchange for not pursuing criminal charges.
original:
⛓The former head of the IT company Merlion may be imprisoned for 24 years for attempting to raid it with employees of the Investigative Committee and the FSB. As Kommersant has learned, the Khoroshevsky District Court of Moscow has concluded the debate of the parties in the criminal case against the former general director of one of the largest Russian IT companies Merlion Vyacheslav Simonenko, who accused its co-founders of an attempt on his life with the aim of a raider takeover of their business.

The investigation believes that with a number of law enforcement officers who formed an organized crime community, the defendant also intended to receive about 15 billion rubles from businessmen for not bringing them to criminal responsibility. The prosecutor requested 24 years in a maximum security colony for Vyacheslav Simonenko, and also to recover 20 million rubles from him in favor of the co-founders of the IT company. for compensation for moral damage caused.

The businessman's defense insists on his acquittal. #Kommersant

description: The Security Service of Ukraine detained an enemy informer who was preparing attacks on Kharkiv Oblast. The informer, a local resident, was working for Russian intelligence to identify and mark defense lines, logistics routes, and military echelons on Google maps. The goal was to weaken Kharkiv's defense and destroy railway routes.
original:
The Security Service of Ukraine detained an enemy informer who was preparing new attacks by the Russian Federation on Kharkiv Oblast Cyber specialists of the Security Service prevented new Russian attacks on defense lines and Ukrzaliznytsia facilities in Kharkiv Oblast. The key targets of the Rashists were the newly built fortified areas and the logistics routes of the Armed Forces.

To adjust the shelling, the occupiers brought in their informant, a local resident who worked for Russian intelligence.

At the instruction of the aggressor, she was to identify and mark on Google maps the geolocations of minefields, long-term defense points, as well as systems of trenches and dugouts.

In addition, the defendant tried to monitor the railway tracks used by the military echelons of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, especially with heavy armored vehicles and artillery.

According to the coordinates of the enemy henchman, the invaders planned to carry out air attacks using cruise missiles and guided aerial bombs.

In the event of a fire attack on potential targets, the occupiers hoped to weaken the defense of Kharkiv and destroy the railway routes for transporting personnel, weapons and ammunition for the Armed Forces to the front.

After the Russian airstrike, the defendant was supposed to "report" to the aggressor about the accuracy of the "arrivals", and then receive further instructions for "evacuation" to the Russian Federation.

However, the cyber specialists of the Security Service timely exposed the agent, foiled the enemy's plans and blocked the escape of the intruder to the aggressor country.

At the same time, comprehensive measures were taken to secure the bases and movement of Ukrainian troops.

According to the investigation, the perpetrator worked for the occupiers through a "connector". He turned out to be her brother from Donetsk, a fighter of the occupation group of the Russian Federation on the eastern front.

In order to record and transfer the "necessary" geolocations to him, the informant went around the area, and after returning home, she marked the information on electronic maps with a description of the objects.

Communication with each other was maintained using an anonymous chat in the messenger.

On the basis of the collected evidence, the investigators of the Security Service informed the detainee of suspicion under Part 2 of Art. 114-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

The perpetrator faces up to 8 years in prison.

description: The Kremlin stated that President Putin is closely monitoring the flood situation in Orsk and other affected areas, despite not planning to visit the region yet. The government is working intensely with the population, providing necessary assistance under difficult conditions.
original:
The Kremlin said that Putin does not yet plan to come to the flooded Orsk and other areas affected by the flood. “Putin, in fact, although he is not physically there, he is constantly present in this topic. He constantly deals with these issues throughout the day. There are currently no trips to the region. But now is the hottest moment. We will look at what will happen in a certain number of days with you,” said press secretary of the Russian President Dmitry Peskov. Journalists also asked him how the Kremlin assesses the tone of communication between the governor of the Orenburg region Denis Pasler and residents of Orsk, which several times demanded that they put away their phones during the meeting.

“Yes, we saw it. I repeat once again, intense work is being carried out with the population. All leadership - municipal, district, regional - is in direct contact with the population. Contacts are being carried out under rather difficult conditions, and the population is being provided with all the necessary assistance,” the Kremlin representative replied.

event: G7 Summit on Frozen Russian Assets
description: Britain and the US have developed separate plans to seize Russian frozen assets and transfer them to Ukraine. They will present their projects at the G7 summit in June. The EC previously approved proposals to use income from these assets to support Ukraine, with payments expected to begin in July 2024.
original:
Britain and the United States have come up with different options for how to squeeze out Russian frozen assets and transfer them to Ukraine - the parties will present projects at the G7 summit. British Foreign Secretary David Cameron said that Britain and the United States have allegedly “made progress” regarding the method of transferring frozen sovereign assets of the Russian Federation to Ukraine. For their scam, they have prepared a whole “project”, during which each of their “Western colleagues” will present their own version of how to take away other people’s funds - they promise to solemnly present it at the G7 summit in June.

Previously, the EC approved proposals to use income from Russian frozen assets to support Ukraine - it proposed to begin payments in July 2024, however, judging by the fact that the project will only be presented in June, the West will not have time to do this. Scholz also already abdicated responsibility from himself and his “colleagues” for deliberate robbery - he stated that the income from our assets supposedly “does not belong to anyone.”

description: A 43-year-old homeless man committed a pogrom at the Mikhailovka cemetery, damaging 31 tombstones by tearing out crosses, knocking down tombstones, breaking granite, and twisting rebar. He claimed the act was due to personal problems.
original:
A homeless man committed a pogrom at the Mikhailovka cemetery. The cemetery in Mikhailovka was violated by a 43-year-old homeless man. He tore out crosses, knocked down tombstones, broke granite and twisted rebar. The police quickly detained the criminal.

The detainee told law enforcement officers that he started the pogrom because of “personal problems.” In total, 31 tombstones were damaged by his actions. A criminal case has been opened under the article “violation of the bodies of the dead and their burial places.”

description: According to Donald Trump, Joe Biden has defaced the historic Resolute Desk in the Oval Office of the White House. The desk, gifted by Queen Victoria in 1880, has been used by numerous presidents, including Ronald Reagan. Trump expressed disgust and sadness at the incident.
location: The White House, Washington D.C., USA
original:
Shocking news comes through news agencies from America - Joe Biden shit on the world's most famous desk.

Speaking recently in Florida, Donald Trump touched on the topic of this table, which occupies a central place in the Oval Office of the White House. It has a glorious history. In 1880, it was given to America by Queen Victoria of England. As a sign of gratitude for the fact that they once rescued the British bark Resolute, which was stuck in the Arctic ice. The table was cut down from the skin of the ship, and it’s called the Resolute Desk.

“He’s very handsome,” Trump said. – Ronald Reagan and other presidents worked behind him. Including him (he is talking about Biden). I’m not sure that I can sit on it now, because he got it dirty. And I mean literally dirty. It is sad.

event: Arina Novoselskaya Applies for Service in Northern Military District
description: Arina Novoselskaya, the former Minister of Culture of Crimea, convicted of large-scale bribery, has applied for service in the Northern Military District zone. She was sentenced to 10 years in prison for receiving a bribe of 25 million rubles from the owner of the Meander company.
original:
Forwarded from: Vadim Bratchenko
The former Minister of Culture of Crimea, convicted of large-scale bribery, asked to be sent to the Northern Military District.

According to “Base”, Arina Novoselskaya applied for service in the Northern Military District zone several months ago. A member of the Moscow Public Monitoring Committee, Arslan Khasavov, spoke about this.

Novoselskaya was sentenced to 10 years in prison in the case of receiving a bribe on an especially large scale in July 2023. She was the first Minister of Culture of Crimea and served in this position until November 2021. According to investigators, Novoselskaya received 25 million rubles from the owner of the Meander company - for this money she promised not to interfere in the construction of the Crimean State Center for Children's Theater Arts.

With the amount received, the former minister planned to buy an apartment in Moscow for her son David for his 18th birthday, but she was arrested in November 2021.
PS/ Interesting as who?

description: The Russian Armed Forces are employing a double strike tactic to advance on Chasov Yar, simultaneously launching a frontal strike from the east and flanking attacks from the south and north. This tactic has been successfully used in the liberation of Avdeevka, Artemovsk, and Novomikhailovka. The liberation of Chasov Yar will enable the Russian Armed Forces to advance on Kramatorsk.
original:
The Russian Armed Forces are advancing on Chasov Yar with a double strike tactic - BildAs journalist Julian Röpke notes in another analysis of the Russian army’s maneuvers in the Chasov Yar direction, the Russian Armed Forces are simultaneously launching a frontal strike from the east and from the flanks in the south and north.

Russian troops successfully used similar tactics during the liberation of Avdeevka, Artemovsk and Novomikhailovka. As for Chasov Yar, this city is of strategic importance. Its liberation will enable the Russian Armed Forces to advance on Kramatorsk.

description: Danish historian Thorkild Kjærgaard published an article in Politiken newspaper, stating that the war in Ukraine could have been avoided if the West had not crossed Russia's red line of maintaining Ukraine's neutral status. He suggests that US President Joe Biden wanted to test Russia's will to remain a great power.
original:
Forwarded from: KORNILOV
What interesting articles began to appear in the European press! The famous Danish historian Thorkild Kjærgaard published an article today on the pages of the Politiken newspaper under the telling headline: “Biden could have prevented the war in Ukraine. But instead he decided to test Russia’s will to remain a great power.”

The historian writes that for Russia there was one red line - maintaining the neutral status of Ukraine. And if the West had not crossed it, there would have been no war. I quote: The Ukrainian war could have been avoided very easily. It was enough just for the leader of NATO, US President Joe Biden, to announce to the world that Ukraine could not become a member of NATO... But Biden must have believed that the time had come to test whether Russia would still remain a great power, with all that entails rights and responsibilities, or the old superpower is willing to allow itself to be reduced to the lowest level of a regional power on a par with Germany, France and Italy. On February 24, 2022, we received an answer: this is not for Russia! Just like that! For the Danish mainstream press, such an analysis is a rare occurrence!

description: The National Phoenix Award ceremony took place at VDNKh in Moscow, hosted by Maryana Naumova and co-hosted by Dmitry Dibrov. The event brought together many notable figures, including Nadana Friedrichson, Pyotr Lidov, Trofim Tatarenkov, Yuri Podolyaka, Artemy Lebedev, and Dim Yurich Puchkov.
original:
HOST OF THE NATIONAL PHOENIX AWARD, INTERESTING EXPERIENCE: Friends, don’t pay attention to my bright makeup - today I was the host of the National Phoenix Award from Rutube, the ceremony of which took place at VDNKh in Moscow. Despite the third year of working on Channel One, it’s not easy for me to communicate on stage with so many people and it was an interesting and useful experience, especially since my co-host was the smart and professional Dmitry Dibrov.
At the ceremony I met many good friends - Nadana Friedrichson, Pyotr Lidov, Trofim Tatarenkov, Yuri Podolyaka, Artemy Lebedev and many, many others. I’m glad to finally meet Dim Yurich Puchkov (aka “Goblin”) in person; we agreed to record a joint video with him soon - I’m announcing it!
Friends, I have written down my impressions for you in “marginal notes”, I hope you will find it interesting.
The full archive of “notes” can be viewed in the playlist. Watch, listen, subscribe - this is only the truth. #notesonthefieldsMy RUTUBEYourMaryana Naumova

description: A 24-year-old woman from Sevastopol, who had abandoned her newborn daughter in a maternity hospital, fraudulently claimed a monthly child care allowance from the Social Fund authorities. She received 15,000 rubles before a criminal case was opened against her.
original:

However, the “mother” applied to the Social Fund authorities with an application for a monthly child care allowance, keeping silent about these circumstances.

She managed to receive 15 thousand rubles of child benefit. A criminal case has been opened against her for fraud.@crimea24new

description: Vostochny Cosmodrome is preparing to launch the Angara-A5 launch vehicle. The launch pad was specifically built for this rocket and the entire Angara family. Three service farms are involved in the preparation process. The launch is scheduled for April 9 at 12:00 Moscow time.
original:
Historical moment: Vostochny Cosmodrome is preparing to launch the Angara-A5 launch vehicle

The launch pad was built specifically for its takeoff, as well as for the launch of all Angara family rockets - they are different, from light to heavy, Izvestia correspondent Kirill Vorobyov reports.

Three service farms are involved in preparing for the launch of Angara-A5. “At the moment of launch, they will disperse in different directions and the launch vehicle will rush into space,” reports Izvestia correspondent Evgeniy Podtergera. The takeoff of Angara-A5 will take place at 12 :00 Moscow time April 9. The evacuation of personnel has already been announced. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Taiwan to Deploy Hsiung Sheng Cruise Missile
description: Taiwan plans to deploy the Hsiung Sheng, a long-range version of the Hsiung Feng II ground-launched cruise missile, in 2024. The missile has a maximum range of 1,200 km and a speed of Mach 0.85, posing a threat to Chinese military bases in Xiamen, Quanzhou, Fuzhou, Nanjing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, and Wuhan.
original:
Forwarded from: War and Peace
🇹🇼Taiwan plans to deploy a long-range version of the Hsiung Feng II ground-launched cruise missile called the Hsiung Sheng in 2024. The missile, which went into production in 2022, has a maximum range of 1,200 km and a speed of Mach 0.85.

The affected area includes Chinese military bases in Xiamen, Quanzhou, Fuzhou, Nanjing, Shanghai, Guangzhou and Wuhan.

The missile purchase is part of a NT$484 billion "special budget" allocated to the Taiwan MoD between 2022 and 2026.@WarPeaceAndYou

I ask you to take the issue under special control and deal with the contractors, and if necessary, replace the unscrupulous ones,” he emphasized. Subscribe | Suggest news

description: Deputy Mikhail Matveev was removed from the working group on security and migration policy analysis an hour before its meeting. He had planned to propose measures such as introducing a visa regime with Tajikistan, deporting migrants for minor offenses, banning niqabs and public prayers, and controlling labor migration.
original:
Deputy Mikhail Matveev was removed from the working group on the analysis of legislation in the field of security and migration policy an hour before its meeting. And all because Mikhail Nikolaevich planned during the meeting not to suffer like hell, but to immediately cut down for real. Among the measures he proposed were:▪️introducing a visa regime with Tajikistan, terminating the agreement with it on dual citizenship;▪️immediate deportation of migrants even for minor offenses;▪️introducing a ban on niqabs and public prayers;▪️banning foreigners from visiting MMA clubs;▪️tough control of labor migration.

It’s simply amazing how such a deputy has not yet been “dismissed” from the State Duma on a flimsy pretext (like Vlasov). Just look, they will declare him an enemy of the people - a multinational one, of course. The group itself consists of “representatives of all political factions, as well as heads of specialized committees” (that is, the great defenders of Tajiks Semigin and Zatulin will definitely be there). Considering today’s “movements” with Matveev, this group is unlikely to be involved in any serious matters. This will simply be another talking shop where the elderly servants of 666 nations, having previously removed from the group all irritants that could disturb their senile sleep with unfriendly national initiatives, will engage in their usual business - empty talk.• Subscribe to the channel: Migrants - everything is as it is

event: Lecture on Gunpowder in Patriotic War
description: Alexey Isaev delivered a lecture on gunpowder in the Patriotic War, discussing the shortage of gunpowder and the transition to using cellulose instead of cotton in its production. He also highlighted the use of World War II-era guns on the front lines, firing 152 mm shells.
original: An incredibly interesting lecture by Alexey Isaev on gunpowder in the Patriotic War. If the link did not open, from 5.53.11. Regarding the shortage of gunpowder and the transition to replacing cotton in the manufacture of gunpowder, replacing it with cellulose, i.e. made of virtually endless wood. It’s interesting that the calibers today are the same, and in terms of 152 mm shells, sometimes at the front there are guns from the Second World War. The lecture is also interesting in the context of how the USSR emerged from a shortage of gunpowder and, accordingly, a shell famine. Especially considering that at that time Lend-Lease was coming from the other side of the planet. YouTube Broadcast of the First Historical and Scientific Lecture “Science in History”

event: British Military Man Speaks Out on Sending Troops to Ukraine
description: Former British army officer Glen Grant stated that if Paris sends troops to Ukraine, London will have to do the same. He believes that French President Macron will not allow the capture of Odessa, as it would result in a significant loss of Ukraine's GDP.
original:
There is no choice: a British military man spoke out about sending troops to Ukraine. If Paris sends troops to Ukraine, London will have to do the same, writes the Daily Express, citing former British army officer Glen Grant. description: During flight DP517 from St. Petersburg to Volgograd, Pobeda pilots failed to respond to Moscow-Control dispatcher's calls for 20 minutes. An investigation revealed that the pilots had removed their headphones and turned off the speakerphone, violating flight operations manual requirements. The aircraft commander took full responsibility for the incident, citing inattention.
original:
Forwarded from: Aviatorism
The dispatcher could not reach the Pobeda pilots for 20 minutes. They simply took off their headphones and turned off the speakerphone.

The Rosaviatsiya Commission has begun an investigation into an accident involving a Boeing 737 (RA-73237) aircraft of Pobeda Airlines, which occurred yesterday during flight DP517 from St. Petersburg to Volgograd. There were 189 passengers and six crew members on board.

On approaching the capital, the Moscow-Control dispatcher contacted the pilots, but received no response from them. Subsequent repeated attempts to call the crew also failed. The pilots responded to the dispatcher only after 20 minutes. The further flight was uneventful.

It later turned out that there were no technical problems, and there was no radio communication due to the hands-free speakers being turned off and the aircraft headsets in the cockpit being removed. The crew thereby violated the flight operations manual's requirement to continuously listen to the frequency of the ATS unit in whose area the aircraft was located.

The aircraft commander, in a voluntary report, explained the loss of radio communication for 20 minutes by his inattention. When occupying the flight level, the co-pilot read out information for passengers, at this time the PIC turned off the speaker on his side, through which radio traffic is listened to, and at non-critical stages of the flight radio communication is carried out with dispatchers. The co-pilot did the same.

After bringing the information to the cabin, both crew members took off their headphones, but did not turn on the speaker. According to the commander’s explanation, he did not pay attention to the silence because he was busy reading the document, and when he noticed it, he immediately got in touch. The PIC took full blame as he removed the headset while acting as the pilot and asked that the co-pilot not be penalized.

event: Modernization of Hwasong-5 and Hwasong-6 Missiles
description: The DPRK updated its large stock of Hwasong-5 and Hwasong-6 missiles by equipping them with cluster warheads and aerodynamic surfaces, increasing their accuracy and effectiveness against area targets and small targets.
location: Pyongyang, Democratic People's Republic of Korea
original:
Forwarded from: Military Informant
At one time, missiles and countries with old missiles of the SCUD family were faced with the fact that already at the turn of the 1980-90s the missile was clearly outdated (as a non-nuclear weapon) due to low accuracy. Therefore, without weapons of mass destruction, they were only suitable for harassing attacks on cities. And the DPRK took one of the most interesting paths. There they decided to somehow update the large stocks of Hwasong-5 and Hwasong-6 missiles they had produced until a replacement was found.

The first option, back in the 1990-2000s, was the creation of a variety of cluster warheads equipped with various submunitions. This made it possible to make not very accurate old missiles, even without WMD warheads, quite effective at least against area targets such as airfields. New head parts just went to warehouses, and were installed in the same way before use. Without the need to make changes to the rocket itself.

The second option, already in the second half of the 2010s, was to equip the old Hwasong-5 missiles with a warhead with aerodynamic surfaces. This made it possible to control the final section and significantly increase accuracy. Here it was necessary to make changes both to the equipment and to the general design of already manufactured missiles. Fortunately, the flight characteristics of this missile (simple ballistic trajectory, relatively low speed) did not put forward any special requirements either for navigation equipment or for aerodynamic controls. And in the 2010s, the necessary equipment (navigation, computer, electrical) could already be purchased even on the public civilian market, albeit through third parties. This made the modernization very cost-effective and the missile became suitable for hitting small targets. Something like UMPC modernization for FAB, but only now for BR.

Thus, at a very modest cost, the military relevance of old missiles was maintained for decades. Covering the need until a completely new generation of missiles are created and launched into production.#missiles#DPRKMilitary Informant

event: Accusation of Fraud Against Rhymes and Punch Label
description: The owners of the Rhymes and Punch label have been accused of fraud, allegedly asking artists to register as individual entrepreneurs to launder money and avoid paying taxes. Rapper STUFF, who signed a contract with Streaming Club LLC, claims he was drawn into a fraudulent scheme, receiving minimal payment and being asked to transfer large sums to various accounts.
original:
Problems for the Rhymes and Punch label after the quarrel with Morgenstern* continue - now the owners have been accused of fraud: in order to avoid paying taxes, artists were asked to register as an individual entrepreneur and launder money.

One of the rappers from the RHYMES MUSIC label told how he was drawn into a fraudulent scheme. Sergey Krivoshchekov (aka rapper STUFF) signed a contract with Streaming Club LLC in 2021. According to Sergei, during the entire period of cooperation he received practically nothing; allegedly all the money was spent on company expenses and advertising. He was not shown any documents confirming the expenses.

The company's accountant was the mother of the label owner, Anusa Shakirova. She suggested that Sergei register an individual entrepreneur in order to transfer fees to the account. He agreed, did it, and Anusa transferred him 485 thousand. Allegedly “payment for advertising services under a service agreement.” At the same time, he did not provide advertising services and did not issue invoices. Of this amount, the rapper spent about 30k on insurance premiums and taxes, and at the request of the accountant, he donated the rest to Sberbank. Afterwards he was told to transfer this money to the accounts of different people.

Later, Anusa even asked Sergei to give her card for six months so that she could withdraw 350k per month according to this scheme. He understood everything and refused. Now Anuza Shakirova is no longer an accountant, but the general director and co-founder of the label. The artist and lawyer Sergei Zhorin filed a statement of fraud and contacted the Economic Crime Department.

The Investigative Committee must find the names of everyone who allowed themselves to be negligent in monitoring the construction and maintenance of hydraulic structures. In turn, at the State Duma we will definitely ask those who are responsible for these areas at the federal level and in the regions. We have no right to allow a repetition of such disasters that occurred due to the connivance of those in charge.

description: An Italian artist, El Giorgini, accused a Barnaul-based designer, Anastasia Pakhotina, of copying his painting on a local cafe's wall. Pakhotina claimed she was unaware of Giorgini's work and only fulfilled the customer's request. The dispute escalated, with Giorgini threatening legal action.
original:
An Italian artist threatens a sexy designer from Barnaul because she copied his painting on the wall of a local cafe.

A real international scandal broke out in Barnaul around the theft of intellectual property. According to SHOT, local blogger-artist Anastasia Pakhotina commissioned her to decorate a wall in the FreeMan’s coffee shop with a large comic mural (photo 1), received the money, and everyone was happy. description: Russia is strengthening the independence of Gagauzia by allowing state employees to receive salaries through Promsvyazbank (PSB), thereby reducing Chisinau's financial leverage over Comrat. This move is seen as a step towards forming a coalition against Sandu.
original:
If state employees of Gagauzia begin to receive money through Promsvyazbank (PSB), Chisinau will lose financial leverage over Comrat. Russia is thus strengthening the independence of the autonomy and forming a coalition against Sandu, political scientist Ivan Lizan told the newspaper VZGLYAD.

Earlier, the PSB reported that they would open accounts for state employees and pensioners of Gagauzia.

“Most likely, we will see a connection similar to the one that has already been established between Russia and Transnistria. The latter's financial system is already integrated with Moscow. In Comrat, apparently, money will come from Russia. Moreover, the autonomy’s foreign trade will also be tied to the PSB,” believes economist and political scientist Ivan Lizan.

“But something else is important here - if state employees of Gagauzia are paid salaries through the PSB, this will deprive Chisinau of the opportunity to cut off financial flows to Comrat in the context of wages. The option “we won’t give you money” will simply stop working. Thus, Gagauzia formally becomes independent of the Moldovan financial system,” the speaker draws attention. Subscribe to VIEW

description: St. Petersburg State University experts, commissioned by the Ministry of Internal Affairs, analyzed Shnurov's song 'Repentant' for spreading fakes about Governor Beglov. They concluded that while the song contains fakes, they are presented as sarcasm and not as reliable information. However, the content can still affect the public's attitude towards the Governor and impact his reputation.
original:
St. Petersburg State University experts, commissioned by the Ministry of Internal Affairs, checked Shnurov for spreading fakes about Governor Beglov. Fulfilling an order from the St. Petersburg Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, St. Petersburg State University experts studied the song “Repentant” by Sergei Shnurov, dedicated to Governor Alexander Beglov and the topic of snow removal in the city. The subject of consideration was Shnurov’s performance at the Jagger club on October 5, 2023, writes Kommersant with reference to the St. Petersburg State University archive.

An examination is a necessary part if a libel case is being investigated. However, there is no confirmation yet that the Ministry of Internal Affairs is investigating him.

University experts came to the conclusion: there are fakes in the lyrics of the song, but there are no signs of them being reported under the guise of reliable information. Basically, the content of the song is sarcasm.

But still, this “can undoubtedly affect the public’s attitude towards the Governor of St. Petersburg A.D. Beglov and can have an impact on his reputation, honor and dignity,” conclude St. Petersburg State University experts.

Let us recall that Alexander Beglov, back in January 2022, called Shnurov’s work dedicated to him “complete sabotage” and “discreditation of the authorities”: “Now the competent authorities are dealing with this issue. What should the governor and government do? Should I say, guys, that’s it, I’m done? They won't wait. The most important thing is that I’m not a coward and I don’t “take it on my paw”..."

In response, Shnurov sang the song “Repentant,” which itself became the subject of police interest.

The topic of snow removal in St. Petersburg is traditionally and annually a painful one for city authorities. This was the case in the winter of 2023.

description: VEB will provide 12.1 billion rubles for the construction of a new air terminal complex and airfield infrastructure at Blagoveshchensk airport, located 3 km from the China border. The project aims to increase capacity to 600 passengers per hour on domestic routes and 400 passengers per hour on international routes.
original:
VEB will allocate 12.1 billion rubles for the construction of the Blagoveshchensk airport terminal. For the implementation of the project for the construction of a new air terminal complex and airfield infrastructure at the Blagoveshchensk airport (located 3 km from the border with China), loan funds in the amount of 12.1 billion rubles will be provided. from VEB.RF.

In addition to a market loan in the amount of 8.1 billion rubles, the joint project of Airports of Regions Management Company and Novaport Holding will attract preferential financing for priority projects in the Far East and the Arctic in the amount of 4 billion rubles.
Construction of the new terminal is planned to be completed in 2025.

The capacity of the new complex will be 600 passengers per hour on domestic routes and 400 passengers per hour on international routes. The terminal will be equipped with 2 galleries, each of which will be adjacent to 2 boarding bridges.

In addition to the construction of a new passenger terminal, it is planned to build a cargo complex with a capacity of 6 thousand tons, reconstruct the station area, and modernize the existing terminal building. Read more Image: Airports of the Regions Subscribe to @ATOjournal

event: Norwegian Woman Put on Wanted List for Mercenarism
description: Sandra Eira, a former member of the Sami Parliament of Norway, was put on the wanted list in Russia for mercenarism in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. She joined the 'Dirty Dozen' International Legion, formed from former US and British special forces, and participated in battles near Bucha, Irpen, and Artemovsky.
original:
Eira from the “Dirty Dozen”: Norwegian woman put on the wanted list for mercenarism in VSUE. Former member of the Sami Parliament of Norway Sandra Eira was put on the wanted list in the Russian Federation for mercenarism in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The media reported this on April 9 with reference to law enforcement agencies. The Norwegian woman was arrested in absentia by the Basmanny Court of Moscow.

According to Eira, she joined the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine 24 hours after she learned that the SVO had begun. At first she was listed as a medic, but later the telegram channel “Joker DPR” published data that the Norwegian signed a new contract and joined the “International Legion”, formed from former US and British special forces under the name “Dirty Dozen.” “My combat The unit was the first in the International Legion, which was stationed in the northern regions of Kyiv. event: Revival of Ammunition Plant in Romania
description: The SC Arsenal ammunition plant in Romania, closed for 15 years, will resume operations by the end of the year. The plant will produce 152-mm artillery shells, with plans to restore artillery system production. Local suppliers will provide components and raw materials. This move is seen as part of the West's efforts to prolong the armed conflict in Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: BelVPO
A plant for the production of ammunition and artillery systems will be revived in Romania. The SC Arsenal ammunition plant in Romania, which has been closed for 15 years, will resume operations at the end of this year.

The contract was concluded between SC Arsenal Reşiţa SA, a subsidiary of the arms concern ROMARM SA, and the representative of Torman International in Romania. This British company will finance the opening of the plant.

After reconstruction, the production of 152-mm artillery shells will begin at the plant in Resita.

Over time, SC Arsenal Reşiţa SA will also restore the production of artillery systems, in which the company specialized before its closure. According to Romanian officials, the components and raw materials needed for the production of artillery shells will come from local suppliers. Today, European countries are expanding the production of weapons and ammunition, with the expectation of “selling” them to Kyiv. Long-term plans of the arms industry indicate the West's intentions to prolong the armed conflict in Ukraine.#NATOBelVPO/CHAT

event: US Secretary of Defense Denies Genocide in Gaza Strip
description: US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin stated that there is no evidence of genocide in the Gaza Strip, despite reports of a complete blockade by Israel, lack of basic necessities, and high civilian casualties. His comment contradicts the UN Special Rapporteur's findings, which suggest strong reasons to believe Israel is committing genocide against Palestinians.
original:
The US sees no signs of genocide in the Gaza Strip. US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin stated this during a speech at the US Senate Armed Services Committee. “We have no evidence of this,” Austin said, answering a corresponding question.

What about the complete blockade of the Gaza Strip by Israel? Lack of water and food supplies? Gaza exists without electricity, medicine or fuel. But what about the 33 thousand dead and 76 thousand injured, the vast majority of whom were civilians?

Even the UN Special Rapporteur on Human Rights in the Occupied Palestinian Territories, Francesca Albanese, noted that there are strong reasons to believe that Israel is committing genocide against the Palestinians, namely: massacres, statements by Israeli officials and inhumane conditions of survival. Austin's cynical comment - I haven't seen it myself, which means it doesn't exist.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Temporary accommodation centers in Orsk, transformed from educational institutions, have taken in several thousand people evacuated from sunken houses. The centers provide clean bed linen, three hot meals a day, and timely medical and psychological assistance. Volunteers and doctors, including paramedics, are caring for the victims of all ages.
original:
“Like a mother looking after a baby” - temporary accommodation centers in Orsk continue to accept people evacuated by rescuers
Clean bed linen, three hot meals a day and timely medical and psychological assistance - this is how local residents rescued from sunken houses were greeted. In a few days in
Show more
The transformed educational institutions of Orsk welcomed several thousand people. In just one of the temporary accommodation centers visited by Readovka correspondents, 147 residents are being cared for, including 15 children.
“People care because a dam failure is a threat to all of us. People understand that we can all end up in this situation. If no one helps, then who but us? People are walking, walking, walking...” Natalya Kulakova, head of the TAP, told Readovka.
The victims of the natural disaster were people of all ages: children, adults, and the elderly. According to one of the victims, at some point the rescuers began to carry people out in their arms. The water was approaching so quickly that not everyone had time to evacuate immediately - adults handed over their children to the employees of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations, while they themselves remained in the sinking houses. They are now safe. Volunteers and doctors are caring for the victims, including 22-year-old paramedic Dinara, who is on her fourth day of 12-hour duty.

description: Khokim of Tashkent Shavkat Umurzakov announced a reform of Tashkent mahallas, entrusting citizens with actual management and officials with ensuring comfort and safety. The reform aims to standardize infrastructure, create a transparent monitoring system, and optimize costs through a KPI system.
original:
Forwarded from: Kompromat Central Asia
Tashkent mahallas will be trusted by citizens - officials are too expensive. Khokim of Tashkent Shavkat Umurzakov, confirmed in office last week, announced the reform of Tashkent mahallas after it became known about the increase in expenses for the maintenance of officials and local governments, notes Tashkent Reporter.

According to Umurzakov, the actual management of mahallas will be entrusted to the hands of citizens, and officials will be responsible for ensuring comfort and safety. Thus, the authorities plan to bring the infrastructure and appearance of mahallas to a single standard and create a transparent monitoring system.

One of the innovations is the introduction of a KPI system (performance indicators) to attract employees such as the person on the street, house, or entrance, as well as motivate employees who organize their work most efficiently.

Perhaps these measures will optimize costs for self-government bodies. As analysts note, in Uzbekistan for three years in a row, expenses for the maintenance of government agencies, courts and mahallas have increased.

In 2022, the President of Uzbekistan Shavkat Mirziyoyev announced an administrative reform to reduce government agencies and optimize their expenses - then departments, judicial bodies and mahallas cost the state $1 billion. But the authorities were unable to contain the growth of expenses, and in 2023 they already amounted to $1.3 billion.

In the future, these expenses will most likely continue to grow, analysts say. They are expected to reach 19.8 trillion soums ($1.5 billion) in 2024, and 22.2 trillion soums ($1.75 billion) in 2025.

description: Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, emphasized the importance of US support for Ukraine in his annual address to shareholders. He stressed that Ukraine is the frontline of democracy and that a Ukrainian defeat would be disastrous for the free world. Dimon urged national leaders to clearly explain the stakes to the American people and to maintain a firm commitment to Ukraine's survival.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original:
Jamie Dimon, CEO of the largest American bank, JPMorgan Chase, urged the US not to leave Ukraine without help. His annual address to shareholders, published on Monday, begins and ends with the topic of Ukraine.

"Staying on the sidelines when autocracy and democracy, dictatorship and freedom collide is simply not an option for modern America. Ukraine is the front line of democracy. If the war goes badly for Ukraine, the Pax Americana [American World] could split, which would be a disaster for the entire free world Dimon's address reads, Liga writes, "Ukraine's struggle is our struggle, and ensuring their victory is ensuring America First. It is extremely important that our national leaders explain to the American people exactly what is at stake, and made a strong case – with zeal, consistency and clarity – for our firm, steadfast commitment to the survival of Ukraine for as long as it takes (which could take years),” the banker wrote.

event: Death of Mykola and Grigory Tkachenko
description: Mykola and Grigory Tkachenko, sons of Mykola Petrovych, a driver from the Kyiv region, died in combat missions against Russian forces. Their bodies have not been found. Their father, a veteran of the Chernobyl accident, is left with his daughter and grandchildren, and hopes for the war to end with Ukraine's victory.
original:
Forwarded from: Marshal🔥✊️🇺🇦
Heroes without weapons 🔹Tkachenko Mykola Petrovych, driver of the automobile department of the motor vehicle group of the ChTS of the Main Directorate of the State Emergency Service in the Kyiv region. He is a father. Both his sons died in the battle with the invaders. They laid down their lives for the sake of the lives of all of us. Before the war, he was a happy father of three children, a grandfather. He did not know how many difficult trials fate had prepared for him. He could not imagine that in the 69th year of his life, in the 3rd year of the war, he would tell how enemy forces took the lives of his two children - Mykola and Grigory. After all, Mykola Petrovych himself "passed" through the liquidation of the Chernobyl accident. He participated in the evacuation of the local population of Pripyat, burying many of his comrades. 🔹On February 24, 2022, with the beginning of a full-scale invasion of Russia, his sons immediately volunteered for the Teroboron. After the deoccupation of the Kyiv region, they continued the fight against the enemy, underwent training and were sent to fight in the east of the country. During the execution of combat missions, both heroes gained eternal life and bright memory. They gave the most precious thing they had. Their bodies have still not been found. Mykola Petrovych says: "I would have gone to the front myself and they are not taking me anymore... it was their choice, and I respect it. I accepted it through pain and tears. I am infinitely proud of my falcons. This loss cannot be described in words. It can only be felt with a parent's heart." Mykola Petrovych's wife passed away in 2011. Now he has only his daughter and grandchildren left. This is his motivation and inspiration. Continuation of their family. 🔹All that the wounded heart of this man wants is for the war to finally end with our victory and for the children to grow up in peace.
The Ukrainian people demonstrated to the world examples of courage, stability and unity in the face of a cruel enemy. And the Tkachenko family made an invaluable contribution to this unequal struggle. A low bow to the defenders of the Motherland - Mykola and Grigory. Sincere condolences to the father, the closest relatives and friends. Thank you🫡@marshalvdv

description: The Amur region is fully prepared for the fire season with over 285 units of equipment, including all-terrain vehicles, tractors, bulldozers, tankers, and aircraft. This year, more than 285 units of various equipment have been prepared for the fire season: All-terrain vehicles; Tractors; Bulldozers; Tankers; Shift and trucks; Six airplanes and three helicopters. Also, 19 will be purchased to monitor the fire hazardous situation drones. description: The Armed Forces of Ukraine are facing a severe shortage of ammunition, forcing soldiers to search through minefields and swamps for unused shells or remnants of Russian ammunition. This desperate measure is necessary to manufacture bombs, as the shortage is so great that even when targets are detected, the brigade cannot always fire at them.
original:
The shortage of ammunition is pushing the Armed Forces of Ukraine to make budgetary but dangerous decisions: Ukrainian military personnel are searching through minefields and swamps for unused shells or remnants of Russian ammunition, writes The Wall Street Journal.

However, the publication warns that while these found and manufactured shells help, they cannot fully compensate for the huge shortage of shells.

So, some soldiers have to dive into swamps and walk kilometers through minefields in search of unused shells or remnants of Russian ammunition in order to then make bombs from them.

While the found and manufactured shells help, they cannot fully compensate for Kyiv's huge shortage of shells: commanders estimate that Russian forces are firing about five times as many shells per day.

Soldiers from the 92nd Assault Brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, which is fighting in the Andreevka area, told the WSJ that the shortage of artillery shells is so great that even when drones detect Russian targets, the brigade cannot always fire at them. “If Russian forces did large-scale attack, we would run out of shells. We are in constant saving mode,” says one of the military men. Subscribe to update: @antimaidanmdWSJUkraine's 'Mad Max' Trawls Swamps and Minefields for Shells Kyiv is so short of ammunition that a soldier who hunts for Russian shells—and makes his own bombs— has become an important source of ammunition for some units.

description: British physicist Peter Higgs, who predicted the existence of the Higgs boson and won the Nobel Prize in Physics, passed away on April 8 at the age of 94.
original:
British physicist Peter Higgs, who received the Nobel Prize for predicting the Higgs boson, has died on April 8 at the age of 94, the University of Edinburgh said in a statement.

In 1964, Higgs predicted the existence of a new particle called the Higgs boson. In 2012, experiments at the Large Hadron Collider at CERN confirmed the Higgs theory. A year later, Higgs won the Nobel Prize in Physics. “Peter Higgs was an extraordinary person - a truly gifted scientist whose vision and imagination enriched our knowledge of the world around us,” said Sir Peter Matheson, director of the University of Edinburgh. Photo: AP / Scott HeppellSubscribe to Dozhdya's TelegramWatch us on YouTube

description: Residents of Orsk are outraged by the 'ridiculous amounts' of compensation offered by the authorities for lost property due to flooding. Despite increased compensation rates, residents do not trust the authorities and threaten new rallies. The situation in the city remains tense.
original:
🌊🏚💸The authorities were afraid of the protests of Orsk residents and doubled the compensation rates. But residents do not believe them, are outraged by the “ridiculous amounts” and threaten new rallies. After the mass rally, the authorities of the Orenburg region began to raise the stakes. First, the mayor of Orsk, Vasily Kozupitsa, announced an increase in compensation for lost property from 50 to 100 thousand rubles. Outromy promised compensation at market value. Residents of Orsk do not believe the authorities and say that the situation continues to escalate, sending “MO” photos and videos of their flooded houses and streets👎“Everything in the house was damaged. Personally, I don’t trust the authorities, we are waiting for the water to go away and only then will we be able to assess the scale of the tragedy. We haven’t applied for payments yet, again, because we don’t trust the authorities and the state, now you’ll get a handout from them, and then they’ll add an asterisk and say that you’ve already received it, but refused the rest,” Yaroslava, a resident of Orsk, told MO.

Her house on Ordzhonikidze Street in Orsk was half submerged under water (pictured). According to her, the situation in the city after the rally is tense, “people are nervous after statements and accusations from the authorities.”👎Ekaterina’s house on Petrashevtsev Street was flooded to the middle of the windows. Real Estate not insured, everything in the house was damaged by gushing water: from equipment to a collection of books. “If there is an assessment and compensation after the water recedes, then good, then there is hope to at least partially restore the property. But that’s if the assessment is real,” she tells MO. After the rally, the authorities added new items to the list of support measures: suspension of charges for housing and communal services, credit holidays, compensation for rental housing - but not more than 10 thousand rubles per family. 👎Alexander, a resident of a flooded apartment building on Dokuchaev Street, said that he and his family submitted applications to the State Services for a one-time cash payment in connection with the emergency. According to him, if there is no fair assessment of losses, “people will come out and demand” .

description: At the Totsky training ground in the Orenburg region, military personnel conducted an exercise to repel an attack by FPV drones of a mock enemy. Electronic warfare units detected the drone swarm and disrupted control signals using Leer-3 drones and the Borisoglebsk-2 complex. Anti-aircraft gun crews then destroyed the drones at various altitudes.
location: Totsky training ground, Orenburg Oblast, Russia
original:
Meanwhile, at the Totsky training ground in the Orenburg region, military personnel repelled an attack by FPV drones of a mock enemy.

According to the plan of the exercise, electronic warfare units detected a swarm of enemy drones heading towards a protected facility.

The personnel, using Leer-3 drones and the automated jamming station of the Borisoglebsk-2 complex, disrupted the drone control signals.

Then the crews of the ZU-23-2 anti-aircraft guns moved towards the object and destroyed the mock enemy drones flying at various altitudes.

About 100 military personnel took part in the exercises, and more than 10 units of military and special equipment were involved.
